title: How to view Verizon text messages online - Quora

response.answer_text: Native text messaging offered by wireless carriers is mobile to mobile only with no delivery to a third party. Years ago marketing had tried to get this as a service but was rejected for legal reasons which included subscriber privacy and liability to the carrier. Now an over the top messaging service may have this as a feature but I am not aware of any that does this. The caveat in what you want is that your messages and those from others can be forwarded to third parties without their knowledge or consent creating privacy concerns. This was the basis for legal rejecting the service. Several use cases were suggested which included subscriber opt-in/out, enterprise owned handsets and service related messaging but we're all rejected for the reasons given above. So the short answer no you cannot see your text messages online.

I use Google Hangouts - Android Apps on Google Play, I can access messages on any device as well as send messages from any device, there is no messaging cost, for anyone that still has a limit on messages. Hangouts can also be used for VoIP calls without using minutes for anyone that still has a limit on minutes. And one can do video chat, similar to Facetime, from any device.  I love Google Hangouts, and when I get a new device, the messages are not all gone.  But the best part of Hangouts, is that I can use multiple accounts, I have both personal and business Google Voice numbers, so I can choose whether to send a message from my Verizon cellular number or either Google number, which is awesome for messaging business clients. And the best part of that, is in managing numbers, it will by default reply to the number a message was received on, so if a business client texts my business number, my business number will respond, not my personal number.  AND I also have a free App called SMS Backup + - Android Apps on Google Play  SMS Backup + free from the Play Store that will back up all of your messages into your GMail. As I need a permanent record for work communications, this is the perfect and easiest solution, I can simply forward received SMS/MMS messages as an email or print them.

Log in to your my Verizon account online (if on mobile browser you'll need to use the desktop view version of the site) and either tap (mobile) or hover your mouse (desktop/laptop) over “My Plan and Services” and select “Send a Message”. This will allow you to send and receive texts from your number as well as read the full text conversations. You need to be using Message+/Verizon Messages for this to work and you can only see/send/receive messages from the number you're logged in as.

It depends on your plan. Do you pay as you go or are you on a contract. If you have unlimited talk and text, you won't be able to recover any text messages. You can go to the Verizon  wireless network page to create an account for your number. Once that is established, you can view all of the different options they offer even if you are pay as you go. I haven't used Verizon in a number of years, however, they did have call and messaing options. I hope this helps you. Please let me know what you find out.Thank you.

Here is a direct link: My Verizon Online Sign In   Enter your phone number and answer the secret question you set up.   Verify your security image and enter your password.   Now you can check your texts in the web UI. Mine is empty since I use Google Voice, which is another good option if you need access to your texts anywhere.

You sign up for Verizon Messages, a relatively new feature.  I don't have the app, just a feature phone, but this lets me read my text messages on my laptop.  http://www.verizonwireless.com/wcms/consumer/products/verizon-messages.html

Go to http://www.vtext.com and sign in using the number you want to see the texts for. If you don't have the number signed up for my Verizon you will have to register it first. This doesn't work for iMessages, just regular texts.

Log into that phone numbers account, go to device overview, click on send a message below the phone number. (In list of blue choices) note: this sends a text to that phone number alerting it that there has been online access, also this only works if that phone is using verizon messages, aka message+

You can install pushbullet on your PC or Mac (not Linux) and see your message and notifications directly in the software. Maybe you could also do that directly with Verizon, less than 10% of companies offer this option.
If you are the main account holder, you can contact Verizon for a listing of numbers and text messages. Otherwise, you can't, unless you have permission.

Can Verizon customers read texts online? Customers, for all cell phone providers, as long as they have their sight, are able to read text, sms, email, and with access to the internet, all resources found there.

I have connected my Verizon phone's SMS via Google Hangouts and can receive and transmit messages using Google Hangouts. Change Hangouts text message settings on AndroidI also use it on my PC as a plugin for Chrome and standalone Windows app.
